column4: Can someone please help. Whenever I try to boot Ubuntu, it goes to the screen that says "Starting Up..." and seems to freeze.
Are you trying to boot a live cd or a HD install
Did this install ever work, or is this the first boot after the install
Is this a dual bot system or single
at the grub menu press e to edit the command line e again one the line is selected.. and remove quiet and splash from the command line then boot.. as my first suggestion
Did you see where it was stopping or the error involved?
It just stops on the screen that says "Startin up..." with the cursor under it blinking
I tried disconnecting my ext HD to see if that did anything but that didn't help either.
Were you trying to install on an external drive, or was the external drive connected when you installed etc?
It was connected when I installed
Im not sure where to start with that, but I would try installing without the external in place to try and make sure the installer can do its job.
It worked before with a previous install, but I re-booted a couple time and got the problem I have now so I deleted the partions and started over.
Ok so it was working.. at one point, which was my first question..  You were able to boot the hd and get in.... answer is still the same try again without the external
